mods:mods.mods:abstract: Expresses thanks for the part Montmorin took in the Spanish ministerÆs [Floridablanca] invitation. Had been issued by mistake but then rewritten with the KingÆs consent, only if given to Jay "as a private gentleman." Included Mr. Carmichael. Believes that if ministers of sovereign states and kingdoms could not accept an invitation refusing to acknowledge their titles and offices, the same holds for the United States, whatever other countries think of their independence. Not a question of making sacrifices for the good of the nation, but rather of sullying its honor. Although aware of the impact on other nations if Jay dines at the MinisterÆs table with other ministers of state, does not see it as an unmitigated advantage, especially if in the guise of a private gentleman. Does not want Floridablanca to think that the refusal would come because of AmericaÆs newly-advantageous position, and wishes to remind him of the conditions under which independence was declared and that they have not made a separate peace with their enemy. Does not wish to offend the Count and wants Montmorin to offer excuses for him in the most delicate way possible.
